Complete your objective. You're dead. Sit back and enjoy the chaos. You cannot win by yourself.\%nl\%Optional Tasks: You must complete your goal at all costs.\%nl\%Fake Tasks: Eliminate all other teams by any means.\%nl\%Fake Tasks: You must complete your objective to win.\%nl\%Fake Tasks: You're dead. Complete your tasks to win!

You are a You are an You are the You are You were a You were an You were the You were
\%player\% (Lover Chat) \%player\% (Impostor Chat) \%player\% (Vampire Chat) \%player\% (Jailor) \%player\% (Jailed) System Anticheat System A kill was attempted in the lobby, attached to \%player\%. \%player\% is joining with these different mods: \%player\% was kicked for using cheat mods: spec:spectate You cannot toggle spectating outside the lobby! You cannot toggle spectator mode while the game is starting! Set yourself as a spectator! You are no longer a spectator! The host has disabled /spec! summary:gamesummary:gamesum roles:role:r No game summary to show! nerf:nerfme:vision You cannot Nerf yourself outside the lobby! Toggled nerf status on. Your vision will be cut in half. Toggled nerf status off. Your vision will be normal. setname:changename:rename:name You cannot change your name outside the lobby! The player name must be at least one character long and cannot be more than 12 characters long! Another player has a name too similar to \%name\%! Please try a different name. Changed player name for the next match to: \%name\%. Welcome to Town of Us Mira v\%modVersion\%!\%nl\%Use the wiki (the globe icon) to get more info on roles or modifiers, where you can use the searchbar. Otherwise, use /help in the chat to get a list of commands.\%nl\%You may disable this message through your option menu. help:support:command:commands:guide Chat Commands: /help - Shows this message /nerfme - Cuts your vision in half /setname - Change your name to whatever text follows the command (like /setname \%randomName\%) for the next match. /spec - Allows you to spectate for the rest of the game automatically. (if enabled by the host) /summary - Shows the previous end game summary /roles - Shows a list of all enabled roles in the game. /rules - Shows the lobby rules saved by the host. up /up [Role] - Ensures you get the requested role next game. Use /up [Role] [PlayerName] to assign a role to another player. (Host + Dev Build only) You must be the host to use /up command. /up command is only available in dev builds. You can only use /up command in the lobby! Invalid /up command usage. Use /up [Role] or /up [Role] [PlayerName]. Please specify a role name. Usage: /up [Role] or /up [Role] [PlayerName]. Role '\%role\%' not found. Make sure the role name is spelled correctly. Player '\%player\%' not found. Make sure the player name is spelled correctly. Successfully requested role: \%role\% for next game. Successfully requested role: \%role\% for player '\%player\%' next game. Host requested role for player '\%player\%' next game. rules System Host has no rules saved. You must be the host to use /rules show. Show Rules On Lobby Join The mod no longer uses /jail chat. Use the red in-game chat button instead. Invalid command. If you need information on chat commands, type /help. If you are trying to know what a role or modifier does, check out the in-game wiki by pressing the globe icon on the top right of your screen. The host has forced a meeting. The host has forced the meeting to end.

Better Maps/Sabotages Configure tasks, cooldowns, doors, vents, sabotages, and more for each map! Every player can get an Alliance, Universal, and/or Faction modifier.
Remote Kill Set Roles Set Modifiers Reset Game All dead players have been revived and tasks have been reset! First Round Death Indicator
Tasks Required to Use Admin Table Tasks Required to Use Cams Tasks Required to Use Doorlog Tasks Required to Use Vitals Tasks Are Checked On Portable Utils You need to complete \%amount\% more tasks to use this! You need to complete \%amount\% more task to use this!

Spectator Watch the chaos from afar Never participate, watch as the chaos unfolds in-game! You don't participate in-game nor interact with players. All you can do is watch.
Chameleon Chameleon Hint Hide away from the seeker temporarily. The Chameleon is a Crewmate that can temporarily go invisible to hide from the seeker. Swoop Turn invisible to the seeker. Unswoop Cancel your swoop early, or let it finish fully to make yourself visible once again.
Swoop Uses In Total Swoop Cooldown Swoop Duration Chameleon Can Vent
Mystic Mystic Hint Understand where kills happen. The Mystic is a Crewmate that gets an arrow pointing to every kill.
Dead Body Arrow Duration
Snitch Snitch Hint Your tasks decrease the timer quicker,\%nl\%at the cost of outing your location. The Snitch is a Crewmate that decreases the time remaining quicker than other players with tasks, but at the cost of outing themselves to the seeker.
Common Task Multiplier Short Task Multiplier Long Task Multiplier Seeker Notify Duration
Noisemaker Noisemaker Hint Alert all crewmates of your location when killed. The Noisemaker is a Crewmate that alerts all players on the map once they are killed, showing a red body indicator.
Frosty Slow your killer for a short duration. After you die, your killer will be slowed down! \%player\% was \%modifier\%, causing you to be slower for \%time\% seconds.
Chill Duration Chill Start Speed
Oblivious You lack seeker awareness. No indicator is present to show you when the seeker is close.
Transporter Transport the seeker upon death. When killed, you will transport the seeker with a random hider.
Giant You are bigger than other hiders. You are bigger than the average player, sticking out to the seeker.
Mini You are smaller than other hiders. You are smaller than the average player, allowing you to hide from the seeker with ease.
Multitasker Your tasks are transparent. All your menus are see-through, allowing you to look behind menus!
Camouflager Camouflager Hint Confuse the hiders by blending in. The Camouflager is an Impostor that can temporarily make all players appear the same as themselves. Camo Trigger a global camouflage to blend in.
Camo Uses In Total Camo Cooldown Camo Duration Camo Disables Proximity Bar
Necromancer Revive the dead to do your bidding Kill crewmates and convert believers\%nl\%into equivalent impostor roles! The Necromancer is an Impostor Cultist role that can kill players like normal, but can also revive Crewmate Believers into Impostor Followers. Revive Reviving Revive the closest convertible body into an impostor.
Sacrifice yourself for dead crewmates in groups\%nl\%at the cost of your own life. Sacrifice yourself for a dead crewmate.
Revive Reviving You have been revived by an Altruist! You have successfully revived \%player\%! Revive a group of dead bodies near you. Revive a group of dead bodies near you. If the revival finishes, you die without leaving a body behind. Revive the closest dead body. If the revival finishes, you die without leaving a body behind.
Revive Type Sacrifice Group Sacrifice Group Revive Revive Duration Revive Range Revive Uses Kill Altruist When Starting Revive Freeze Altruist During Revive Hide Bodies at Beginning Of Revive Killers Alerted Before Revive Killers Alerted After Revive Nobody Neutrals Impostors Neutrals and Impostors
Radiate Color Range Radiate Max Range Sense Duration
Barrier On: \%player\%
Barrier Prevent a Crewmate from being interacted with. The shield will last for \%BarrierCooldown\% seconds. Cleanse Remove all negative effects on a player. (Douse, Hack, Infect, Blackmail, Blind, Flash, and Hypnosis)
Cleric Feedback Cleansed effects on \%player\%: No negative effects were found on \%player\%.
Barrier Cooldown Barrier Duration Cleanse Cooldown Protected Player Sees Barrier Cleric Gets Attack Notification
Deputy Camp crewmates to catch their killer Camp crewmates, then shoot their killer in the meeting! The Deputy is a Crewmate Killing role that can camp other players. Once a camped player dies, the Deputy is alerted to their death. The following meeting, the Deputy may then attempt to shoot the killer of the camped player. If successful the killer dies and if not nothing happens. Camp Camp a player to be alerted once they die. After their death, you may attempt to shoot the killer. If your shot is successful, the killer dies, if not, nothing will happen.
Wait for \%player\%'s death so you can blast their killer in the meeting. Your camped target, \%player\%, has died! Avenge them in the meeting. Deputy Feedback You missed your shot! They are either not the killer or are invincible.
Forensic Inspect crime scenes to find the killer Inspect crime scenes, then examine players to\%nl\%see if they were at the scene. The Forensic is a Crewmate Investigative role that can inspect crime scenes and examine players to see if they were at the crime scene, flashing red if they were there. Inspect Crime scenes will spawn with all dead bodies. Inspect the crime scene and then examine players to discover clues. During the next meeting, you will receive a report revealing the killer's role. Examine Examine players after inspecting a crime scene. You will be told if the player was at the crime scene. You have inspected the crime scene of \%player\%. The killer or anyone that steps foot in the crime scene will flash red when examined.
Examine Cooldown Show Forensic Reports Time Where Forensic Will Have Role Time Where Forensic Will Have Faction
Forensic Body Report The corpse could not give any information.\%nl\%Died \%time\%s ago. The corpse is too old to gain information from.\%nl\%Died \%time\%s ago. The kill appears to have been a suicide!\%nl\%Died \%time\%s ago. The killer appears to be the \%role\%!\%nl\%Killed \%time\%s ago. The killer appears to be a Neutral!\%nl\%Killed \%time\%s ago. The killer appears to be a Crewmate!\%nl\%Killed \%time\%s ago. The killer appears to be a Impostor!\%nl\%Killed \%time\%s ago. \%player\% was at the scene of \%deadPlayer\%'s death!\%nl\%They might be the killer or a witness. \%player\% was not at the scene of the crime.
Engineer Maintain important systems on the ship Vent around and fix sabotages remotely The Engineer is a Crewmate Support role that can vent and fix sabotages remotely. Fix Fixing It doesn't matter where you are on the map, you can use your fix button to instantly fix the active sabotage. You can do this \%engiMaxFixes\% times per game.
Vent Uses Per Game Tasks Required For Additional Vent Use Vent Cooldown Vent Duration Fix Uses Per Game Tasks Required For Additional Fix Use Fix Delay
Haunter Reveal the impostors postmortem!
Complete all your tasks without getting caught to reveal impostors! The Haunter is a Crewmate Ghost who can do tasks. They will appear as a transparent player. If they finish all their tasks, all living players will see who the Impostors are. However, if an Impostor clicks them first, they will become a normal ghost. Impostors get a warning shortly before and when the Haunter finishes their tasks.
Tasks Left Before Clickable Tasks Left Before Alerted Reveal Neutral Roles Can Be Clicked By Everyone Non-Crew Impostors Only
You have alerted the Killers! A Haunter is loose, catch them before they reveal you!
Hunter Stalk the \%color=#FF0000FF\%Impostors\%/color\% Stalk players to get alerted when they use an ability.\%nl\%Once they use an ability, you may kill them. Caught Players: The Hunter is a Crewmate Killing role that can stalk players during the round. If a stalked player uses an ability, they can be killed by the Hunter at any point in the game, even Crew. Stalk Stalking Choose a target to stalk. You can stalk \%hunterMaxStalkUsages\% players. If they use any ability while stalked, they're added to your hitlist and can be killed. If \%player\% uses an ability, you will be able to kill them at any time in the round. \%player\% used an ability on another player! \%player\% used a regular ability!
Hunter Kill Cooldown Hunter Stalk Cooldown Hunter Stalk Duration Initial Stalk Uses Tasks Required For Additional Stalk Use Hunter Sees Interaction Type Stalk Triggered By Interactions All Abilities Hunter Kills Last Voter If Voted Out Hunter Can Report Who They've Killed
Imitator Use the dead to benefit the Crew Use dead players to benefit the crew via imitation in meetings The Imitator is a Crewmate Support role that can select a dead crewmate to imitate their role until they change targets. Certain roles are inaccessible if there are multiple living imitators. Crewmate Imitation All crewmate roles are available besides Politician and Mayor. Roles like Jailor and Prosecutor cannot use their meeting abilities, and Vigi does not get safe shots. Neutral Counterparts Amnesiac Medic | Doom Vigi | Exe Snitch\%nl\%Glitch Sheriff | Fairy Cleric | Inquis Oracle\%nl\%Jester Plumber | Merc Warden\%nl\%Pb/Pest Aurial | SC Medium | WW Hunter Impostor Counterparts Bomber Trapper | Hypnotist Lookout | Janitor Forensic\%nl\%Miner Engineer | Scavenger Sonar\%nl\%Undertaker Altruist | Warlock Veteran
Imitate Neutral Counterparts Imitate Impostor Counterparts Imitate Basic Crewmate Imitator Must Be Guessed As Imitator Imitated Role Imitator or Imitated Role
Investigator Find evildoers by tracing footsteps You can see everyone's footprints. The Investigator is a Crewmate Investigative role can see player's footprints throughout the game. Swooped players' footprints will not be visible to the Investigator.
Footprint Size Footprint Interval Footprint Duration Anonymous Footprint Footprint Vent Visible
Jailor Jail and execute \%color=#FF0000FF\%evildoers\%/color\% Jail crewmates to private talk to them, and\%nl\%execute them if they are an evildoer Jail crewmates to private talk to them, and\%nl\%execute them if you so desire The Jailor is a Crewmate Power role that can jail other players. During a meeting, the Jailor can choose to execute their jailed player. (Unless the Jailor is an Imitator) Jail Jail a player. During the meeting everyone will see who is jailed. You can privately talk with your detained player using the private chatbox toggle. Execute Execute (Meeting) Execute the detained player. If the player is a crewmate, the Jailor will lose the ability to Jail.
Jail Cooldown Max Number Of Executes Jail Same Person Twice In A Row Jailee Can Use Public Chat
Jailor Feedback Communicate with your jailee in the chatbox above the user report button. \%player\% cannot be executed! They must be Invulnerable or blessed! \%player\% was a crewmate! You can no longer jail anyone! \%player\% was successfully executed!
Lookout Keep your eyes wide open Watch other crewmates to see what roles interact with them The Lookout is a Crewmate Investigative role that can watch other players during rounds. During meetings, they will see all roles who interact with each watched player. Watch Watch a player or multiple, the next meeting you will know which players interacted with the watched ones. You will know what roles interact with \%player\% next meeting.
Watch Cooldown Initial Players That Can be Watched Lookout Watches Reset After Each Round Get More Uses From Completing Tasks
Mayor Reveal yourself to save the Crew Lead the crew to victory! Lead the evils to victory! Lead the impostors to victory! Reveal yourself whenever you wish. The Mayor is a Crewmate Power role that gains three votes and is revealed to all players, also changing their look in meetings.
Medic Create a shield to protect a Crewmate Protect a crewmate with a shield to defend them from attacks Shielded: \%player\% The Medic is a Crewmate Protective role that can give a Shield to a player. Shield Give a Shield to a player, protecting them from being killed by others
Show Shielded Player Who Gets Murder Attempt Indicator Can Give Shield Away Next Round Max Amount of Shield Uses Shield Breaks On Murder Attempt Show Reports in Chat Time Where Medic Will Have Name Time Where Medic Will Have Color Type Medic Shielded Shielded + Medic Everyone Nobody
Medic Body Report The corpse could not give any information.\%nl\%Died \%time\%s ago. The corpse is too old to gain information from.\%nl\%Died \%time\%s ago. The kill appears to have been a suicide!\%nl\%Died \%time\%s ago. The killer appears to be \%player\%!\%nl\%Killed \%time\%s ago. The killer appears to be a darker color!\%nl\%Killed \%time\%s ago. The killer appears to be a lighter color!\%nl\%Killed \%time\%s ago.
Medium Watch the spooky ghosts Follow ghosts to get clues from them The Medium is a Crewmate Investigative role who can Mediate to see one ghost per use. Both the Medium and Ghost then have an arrow showing them where each other are at all times. Mediate Communicate with the dead, which may lead you to the killers.
Mediate Cooldown Reveal Appearance of Mediated Target Arrow Visibility Medium Mediated Medium + Mediated Disabled Who is Revealed Oldest Dead Newest Dead Random Dead All Dead
Mirrorcaster Reflect attacks onto others Protect a player with a Magic Mirror.\%nl\%If they are directly attacked, then\%nl\%unleash the attack onto another player! Protecting: \%player\% The Mirrorcaster is a Crewmate Protective role that can cast a Magic Mirror on a player to protect them. If attacked directly, the Mirrorcaster can then unleash onto another player. Magic Mirror Protecting Place a Mirror on a player. If the player is attacked directly, then you will be notified, and you will be able to unleash onto another player. Roles that ignore the Magic Mirror are Arsonist, Veteran, Pestilence, Bomber (if the player is bombed), and a few others. Unleash Once the Magic Mirror shatters, use its power to unleash the attack onto another player! The player you tried to protect was already dead! \%player\% died to an indirect attack, which your mirrors couldn't protect from. \%player\% was not attacked.
Who Gets Murder Attempt Indicator Mirrorcaster Mirrorcaster + Killer Magic Mirror Cooldown Magic Mirror Duration Unleash Cooldown Information Received Upon Attack Role Subalignment Faction Nothing Accumulate Multiple Unleashes Max Number Of Magic Mirrors
\%player\% was attacked by the \%attackerRole\%! You can now unleash the attack onto another player! \%player\% was attacked! You can now unleash the attack onto another player!
Monarch Knight Crewmates to give extra votes Knight crewmates to aid in meetings, but\%nl\%avoid knighting Evildoers. Knight evildoers to aid them in meetings. Knighted players each gain \%amount\% vote(s). Living knights give you protection. Living crewmate knights give you protection. You are notified when a knighted player dies. The Monarch is a Crewmate Power role that can hand out additional votes to other players. Knight Knight a player, giving them \%amount\% vote(s) Change Flash If configurable, the Monarch can change how their defense appears to other attackers. The color can flash like a Cleric, Medic, Mercenary, Warden, or not flash at all!
Mystic Know when and where kills happen Understand when and where kills happen The Mystic is a Crewmate Investigative role that gets an alert when someone dies.
Dead Body Arrow Duration Show Death Pop-Up
Oracle Get Crewmates to confess their sinss Bless crewmates to protect them in meetings, and\%nl\%make them confess in the meeting The Oracle is a Crewmate Protective role that can get another player to confess (revealing their faction with \%revealAccuracy\%% accuracy if the Oracle dies) or can protect a player from meeting abilities. Bless Blessing a player prevents any harm from being done to them in the meeting. Confess Make a player confess in a meeting, giving a vision of three possible evils (including the confessor), and also reveal their faction to everyone with \%revealAccuracy\%% accuracy when the Oracle dies.
Confess Cooldown Bless Cooldown Reveal Accuracy Neutral Benign Show Up As Evil Neutral Evils Show Up As Evil Neutral Killers Show Up As Evil Neutral Outliers Show Up As Evil Neutrals That Appear Evil Benign Evils Killing Outliers None
Your confessor failed to survive so you received no confession Too few people alive to receive a confessional \%player\% confesses to knowing that there are no more evil players! \%player1\% confesses to knowing that they, \%player2\% and/or \%player3\% is evil! Your blessing has saved \%player\% from death! \%player\% survived due to being blessed by an \%color=#FFBF00BF\%Oracle\%/color\%!
Plumber Kick out the pesky venters onboard Flush the vent system to kick venters out, and\%nl\%barricade vents to block them the next round Note: Barricades Stay For \%roundCount\% Round(s) Vents List Preparing... \%roomName\% Vent \%roundsRemaining\% Round(s) Remaining This vent will be blocked at the beginning of next round. The Plumber is a Crewmate Support role that can place Barricades on vents and Flush anyone out of vents. Flush Flushing the vents makes every vent open and close, kicking out anyone actively in a vent. The Plumber also gets an arrow pointing to every flushed player for one second. Block Block a vent by placing a barricade on it for the next round, preventing players from using it. This vent will be blocked at the beginning of the next round.
Flush Cooldown Block Cooldown Initial Number Of Barricades Amount Of Rounds Barricades Last Get More Barricades From Completing Tasks
Politician Campaign to become the Mayor! Campaign crewmates in hopes to become the Mayor! At least half of\%nl\%the innocent players must be campaigned to reveal successfully The Politician is a Crewmate Power role that can reveal themselves to the crew as the Mayor, given that they have campaigned at least half of the crewmates. Campaign Give a player a ballot, which will only be useful to you if they are a Crewmate. Reveal Reveal (Meeting) If you reveal, and you have more than half of the crewmates campaigned (or no other crewmates remain), you will become the Mayor! Otherwise, your ability will fail. If you reveal, and you have more than half of the crewmates campaigned (or no other crewmates remain), you will become the Mayor! Otherwise, your ability will fail and you cannot campaign the following round.
Campaign Cooldown Prevent Campaigning on Failed Reveal
You need to campaign more Crewmates! You may not reveal again in this meeting. You need to campaign more Crewmates! However, you may not campaign next round. Politician Feedback
Prosecutor Exile players of your choosing Choose to exile anyone of your choosing The Prosecutor is a Crewmate Power role that can Exile a player, applying five votes to a player of their choosing. They can also see who voted for whom, even if they're anonymous. Prosecute Prosecute (Meeting) Exile any player of your choosing, throwing five votes on them and ignoring all other votes.
Prosecutor Dies When They Exile A Crewmate Max Prosecutions
Seer Reveal the alliance of others Compare the alignment of two players Reveal alliances of other players to find evildoers. Compare two players to check if\%nl\%they are friends or enemies! The Seer is a Crewmate Investigative role that can reveal the alliance of other players. The Seer is a Crewmate Investigative role that can compare two players to see if they have matching or conflicting alignments. Reveal Reveal the faction of a player Intuit Gaze Intuit \%and\% Gaze Compare the alignments of two players by using your Intuit and Gaze abilities on two different people. If they appear as enemies, you will be informed of such. Currently gazing \%player\%. You may change this if needed. Currently intuiting \%player\%. You may change this if needed. You must to pick two targets to gaze and intuit. You can't use yourself to compare! \%gazed\% and \%intuited\% appear to be enemies! \%gazed\% and \%intuited\% appear to be friendly! Previous Comparisons: \%gazed\% vs \%intuited\% (Round \%num\%)
Compare Players Instead of Checking Alignments Reveal/Compare Cooldown Max Uses of Reveal/Compare Neutral Benign Show Friends To All Neutral Evils Show Friends To All Neutral Outliers Show Friends To All Crewmate Killing Roles Are Red Neutral Benign Roles Are Red Neutral Evil Roles Are Red Neutral Killing Roles Are Red Neutral Outlier Roles Are Red Traitor Swaps Colors
Sentry Deploy cameras to monitor the map Place cameras that appear in Security. The Sentry is a Crewmate Support role that can deploy cameras around the map that function like Security cameras. Deploy Deploy a camera at your current location. When it appears depends on settings. View Access Security cameras from anywhere with a limited battery. Battery drains while viewing and does not recharge. Disabled by Comms sabotage. Portable Cameras Unlocked! Portable Cameras are available immediately. Portable Cameras are available after tasks. Cameras (Sentry-only) (Placing...) Max cameras placed (%count%/%max%).
Placement Cooldown Deployed Cameras Visibility Cameras Visible After Can Move While Placing Cameras Instant Portable Cameras (or After Tasks) Initial Cameras Amount Of Rounds Cameras Last Tasks Required Per Camera Max Cameras Placed At Once Portable Cameras Battery Portable Cameras Battery Per Task Blind Spots Blindspot 1 Room Blindspot 2 Room Blindspot 3 Room Blindspot 4 Room Blindspot 5 Room Blindspot 6 Room Blindspot 7 Room Blindspot 8 Room Blindspot 9 Room Blindspot 10 Room

Sheriff Shoot the \%color=#FF0000FF\%Evildoers\%/color\% Kill off the impostors but don't kill crewmates Kill off whoever you wish in hopes of crew losing The Sheriff is a Crewmate Killing that can shoot a player to attempt to kill them. If Sheriff doesn't die to misfire, they will lose the ability to shoot. Shoot Shoot a player to kill them, misfiring if they aren't an Impostor or one of the other selected shootable factions
You can no longer shoot. Misfiring kills you and your target. Misfiring will lead to suicide. Misfiring will lead to your target's death,\%nl\%at the cost of your ability. Misfiring will prevent you from shooting again.
You have lost the ability to shoot!
Kill Cooldown Can Self Report Allow Shooting in First Round Can Shoot Neutral Benign Roles Can Shoot Neutral Evil Roles Can Shoot Neutral Killing Roles Can Shoot Neutral Outlier Roles Valid Neutral Shots Benign Evils Killing Outliers None Misfire Kills Self Target Self + Target Nobody
Snitch Find the \%color=#FF0000FF\%Impostors\%/color\%! Complete all your tasks to discover the Impostors. Find the Impostors! Complete all your tasks to discover \%and\% help the Impostors. Help the Impostors! The Snitch is a Crewmate Investigative role that can reveal the Impostors to themselves by finishing all their tasks. Upon completing all tasks, the Impostors will be revealed to the Snitch with an arrow and their red name.
Snitch Reveals Neutral Killers Snitch Sees Traitor Snitch Sees Impostors In Meetings Tasks Remaining When Revealed
Spy Snoop around and find out Gain extra information on the Admin Table The Spy is a Crewmate Investigative role that gains extra information on the admin table. They not only see how many people are in a room, but see who is in every room.
Who Sees Dead Bodies On Admin Nobody Spy Everyone But Spy Everyone Allow Portable Admin Table For Role Modifier Role + Modifier Disabled Move While Using Portable Admin Starting Charge Battery Charged Each Round Battery Charged Per Task Portable Admin Display Cooldown Portable Admin Display Duration
Swapper Swap votes to save the Crew! Swap votes from one player to another during a meeting The Swapper is a Crewmate Power that can swap the votes of two players in a meeting. Their meeting vote areas will be swapped visually, and the votes will be swapped. If player 1 received the most votes, and you swap them with player 2, player 2 will now be ejected instead. Swap Swap (Meeting) Select two players to swap votes for, and at the end of the meeting, they will swap spots!
Can Call Button
Time Lord Rewind time Use Rewind to pull everyone back a few seconds. The Time Lord is a Crewmate Power role that can rewind time, forcing every player to retrace their steps for a short duration. Rewind Rewinding Rewind time for everyone. Players are forced back along their recent path for the duration. Any deaths that happened within that window are reversed. Time is being rewound! You were revived thanks to the Time Lord!
Rewind Cooldown Rewind History Initial Uses Tasks Required For Additional Rewind Use Can Use Vitals Revive On Rewind Undo Tasks On Rewind Unclean Bodies On Rewind Notify Time Lord On Revive
Sonar Sense everyone's movement Track suspicious players to see where they go The Sonar is a Crewmate Investigative role that can track other players to see their general position across the map, getting colored arrows towards all tracked players. Track Track a player to see where they go. You will have an arrow pointing to their location that will update periodically. It will disappear if they die, or depending on settings, the trackers will be reset after a meeting.

Transporter Choose Two Players To Swap Locations Choose two players to swap locations with one another The Transporter is a Crewmate Support role that can transport two players, dead or alive, to swap their locations. Transport Switch the positions of two players. Players can be transported out of vents. A red flash means one of the players became an invalid target, such as going on a ladder or zipline You have been transported!

You were transported!
Trapper Identify what roles are in play Place traps around the map, revealing roles within them The Trapper is a Crewmate Investigative role that can place traps around the map. If someone stays in it for enough time and enough players go through, they will get a list of their roles in the next meeting in random order. Trap Places a trap. Depending on settings they may stay the entire game or reset after meetings.

Alert Alerting When the Veteran is on alert, any player who interacts with them will be instantly killed, except Pestilence and shielded players, who will ignore the attack. Veteran Warning You were attacked prior to this meeting while on alert!

Warden Fortify Crewmates Fortify crewmates to prevent interactions with them Fortifying: \%player\% The Warden is a Crewmate Protective role that can fortify players to prevent them from being interacted with. Fortify Fortify a player to prevent them from being interacted with. If anyone tries to interact with a fortified player, the ability will not work and both the Warden and fortified player will be alerted with a purple flash.
Show Fortified Player Fortified Warden Fortified + Warden Everyone

Ambusher Kidnap Crewmates into the shadows Pursue a player, then ambush the closest player to them.\%nl\%If the player you ambush dies, then take their body with you. Pursuing: \%player\% The Ambusher is an Impostor Killing role that can pursue a player, getting an arrow to them. They may ambush the closest player next to them. If they manage to kill the player, they will drag their body into the shadows, teleporting back with the Ambusher. Pursue Pursue a player to be able to ambush another player next to them at a later time. Ambush Ambush the closest player to the pursued target to kill them.

Parasite Overtake and control players Overtake a victim to control their movement.\%nl\%Press the same button again to kill them, or wait for the timer. The Parasite can Overtake nearby non-impostors to take control of their movement. By default, while overtaken, the victim looks like the Parasite and cannot use abilities. You can watch them with a PiP camera and kill them at any time, or wait for the control timer to kill them. Overtake Overtake a nearby non-impostor to take control of their movement. By default, you move with WASD and control them with Arrow Keys. If "Parasite Can Move Independently" is disabled, you cannot move and control them with WASD instead. Kill Kill your currently overtaken victim immediately.

Traitor Betray the Crewmates! Betray the crewmates with a new impostor role! The Traitor is an Impostor Power role that spawns after a meeting, in which the spawn conditions are suitable. The Traitor will always be a crewmate, and they may change to a few select roles. Change Role The Traitor can change their role to one of the provided role cards, or gamble on the random. Once they select a role, they stay as that role until they die. However, they must still be guessed as Traitor. Select a role. Random\%nl\%Impostor

Venerer Enhance your abilities with every kill Kill players to unlock ability perks. Your perks allow you\%nl\%to camouflage, sprint, and slow others down in your path. The Venerer is an Impostor Concealing role that can kill players to gain new abilities, preventing others from catching them! However, the ability will be used immediately as they receive it, which will stack up. Camouflage Stage 1 of the abilities.\%nl\%You will appear as a gray bean for all players, allowing you to sneak away from kills. Sprint Stage 2 of the abilities.\%nl\%You will gain the speed of the Flash while hidden from camo. Freeze The Final Stage of the abilities.\%nl\%You will slow down players around you in a radius, as well as being fast and hidden from camo.
Ability Cooldown Ability Duration Sprint Speed Minimum Freeze Speed Freeze Radius
Warlock Charge up your kill button to multi-kill Charge your attack to 100% to kill crewmates in small bursts The Warlock is an Impostor Killing role that can charge up attacks to wipe out the crew quickly. Burst Kill Burst Active Replaces your regular kill button with three stages: On Cooldown, Uncharged, and Charged. If you kill while charging, your burst will be fully reset. Amnesiac Remember the role of a deceased player Find a dead body to remember and become their role. If the dead body's role is a unique role, you will remember the base faction's role instead. Players Doused: The Arsonist is a Neutral Killing role that wins by being the last killer alive. They can douse players and ignite them when close. They can douse players and ignite one of them to ignite all doused players on the map. Douse Douse a player in gasoline. Ignite Kill multiple doused players around you, given that they are within your radius. Kill every doused player on the map as long as you ignite one player close by.

Inquisitor Vanquish the Heretics! Vanquish your Heretics or get them killed.\%nl\%You will win after every heretic dies.\%nl\%If they're all dead after a meeting ends,\%nl\%you'll leave \%and\% announce your victory The roles of your Heretics: The Inquisitor is a Neutral Outlier role that wins if their targets (Heretics) die. The only information provided is their roles, and it's up to the Inquisitor to identify those players (marked with \%symbol\% to the dead) and get them killed by any means necessary.
You will know if \%player\% is a heretic in the following meeting. Inquisitor Report Your inquiry reveals that \%player\% is a heretic! Your inquiry reveals that \%player\% is not a heretic! The \%role\%, \%player\%, has successfully won, as all Heretics have perished! You have successfully won as the \%role\%, as all Heretics have perished! Inquire Inquire a player, which will tell you if they are one of your targets within the meeting. Vanquish Vanquish a player to kill them. If they are a heretic, you will be told, and you can continue vanquishing. However, if the victim isn't a heretic, you will lose the ability to vanquish for the rest of the game.

Chef Fresh and ready to serve Feed the crewmates with cooked corpses.\%nl\%Once your quota is fed, leave in victory! Bodies Fed: \%bodiesFed\% / \%bodiesTotal\% The Chef is a Neutral Outlier role that wins with any other faction as long as they have served enough dead bodies to the crew.
Chef Feedback You have been served a dead body by the Chef! The \%role\%, \%player\%, has successfully won, as they've fed enough players! Juggernaut Lower your cooldown with every kill. With each kill your kill cooldown decreases. Kill Count: \%count\% The Juggernaut is a Neutral Killing role that wins by being the last killer alive. For each kill they get, their kill cooldown gets reduced.

Mercenary Commit bribery to win with others Guard players to get gold upon interaction,\%nl\%then bribe the winners! Gold: \%count\% Bribed: The Mercenary is a Neutral Benign role that can only win by bribing players, allowing them to gain multiple win conditions. Guard Guarding a player allows the Mercenary to absorb an ability used on the target. This will grant them gold, for Bribing. If any bribed targets win, the Mercenary will win with them. Bribe Bribing a player allows the Mercenary to gain their win condition, given that they have gold to spare. Once \%player\% is interacted with, you will get gold in return.

Pestilence Warning A deadly plague has consumed the Crew.\%nl\%\%role\%, Horseman of the Apocalypse, has emerged!

Soul Collector Reap the souls out of Crewmates Reap the souls of others, leaving behind a lasting image The Soul Collector is a Neutral Killing role that takes the soul of players. Instead of leaving a body behind, they leave behind a soul-less decoy that looks identical to the reaped player, standing still. Reap Reaping acts like a kill button, but instead of making a dead body, makes a fake player in its place, appearing alive. You have taken \%player\%'s soul, leaving their lifeless body standing.

Vampire Convert Crewmates and kill the rest Bite other players to convert them or kill them The Vampire is a Neutral Killing role that wins by being the last killer(s) alive. If the bitten player is convertible, and you have not exceeded the maximum number of vampires in a game yet, you convert them into a vampire. Otherwise, they will just die.

Werewolf Rampage to kill everyone Rampage to kill quickly, increase your\%nl\%vision, and vent away temporarily The Werewolf is a Neutral Killing role that wins by being the last killer alive. They can go on a rampage to gain the ability to kill. Rampage Go on a Rampage, gaining the ability to kill and gain Impostor vision. During the Rampage your kill cooldown is significantly lower.

Crewpostor Aid the \%color=#FF0000FF\%Impostors\%/color\% Betray the crewmates as an Impostor. The Crewpostor is a Crewmate Alliance modifier, which forces a crewmate to work for the impostor faction. If all impostors are dead, you become a Traitor. You are the \%modifier\%. You can only win with Impostors, and become \%role\% upon their death.
Egotist Betray the crew to feed your ego Defy the crew, win with killers. The Egotist is a Crewmate Alliance modifier (signified by \%symbol\%). As the Egotist, you can only win if Crewmates lose, even when dead. If no crewmates remain after a meeting ends, you will leave in victory, but the game will continue. You are the \%modifier\%. You can only win if Crewmates lose. The \%modifier\%, \%player\%, has successfully won, as no more crewmates remain! You have successfully won as the \%modifier\%, as no more crewmates remain! The \%modifier\%'s adrenaline grows stronger. Players are now \%newSpeed\% times faster! The \%modifier\%'s adrenaline grows stronger. Cooldowns are now \%newOffset\% seconds shorter! The \%modifier\%'s adrenaline grows stronger. Cooldowns are now \%newOffset\% seconds shorter, and players are \%newSpeed\% times faster! The \%modifier\% has perished, and their adrenaline has diminished!
Lover You are in love with \%player\%. As a lover, you can chat with your other lover (signified with \%symbol\%) during the round, and you can win with your lover if you are both a part of the final three players. You are a \%modifier\% with \%player\%. Chat with them and win with them when you two are part of the final three.
Both Lovers Die And Revive Together Loving Another Killer Probability Neutral Roles Can Be Lovers Lover Can Kill Faction Teammates Lovers Can Kill One Another

Flash You move \%flashSpeed\%x faster. You move \%flashSpeed\% x faster than regular players.
Flash Speed
Giant You are bigger than the average player, moving \%giantSpeed\%x slower You are bigger than regular players, and you also move \%giantSpeed\%x slower than regular players.
Giant Speed
Immovable You cannot be teleported to the meeting area, and you cannot get dispersed or teleported. You are unable to be moved via abilities and meetings.
Mini You are smaller than regular players, and you also move \%miniSpeed\%x faster than regular players. You are smaller than the average player, moving \%miniSpeed\%x faster.
Mini Speed
Radar Get an arrow to the closest player. You have an arrow pointing\%nl\% to the closest player.
Satellite You can broadcast a signal to know where dead bodies are. You can check for bodies on the map, which you can do \%maxUses\% time(s) per game. Broadcast You can check for bodies on the map, which you can do \%maxUses\% time(s) per game. No bodies were found on the map. One body was found on the map. \%count\% bodies were found on the map.
Button Cooldown Max Uses One Usage Per Round Allow Usage in First Round
Shy You become transparent when \%nl\%standing still for a short duration. You blend in with the environment, becoming transparent when staying still.
Transparency Delay Turn Transparent Duration Final Opacity
Sixth Sense Know when someone interacts with you. You will know when someone uses their ability on you.
Sleuth Know the roles of bodies you report. You will see the roles of bodies you report.
Tiebreaker Your vote breaks ties. Your vote allows you to break ties.
Disperser You can disperse players to vents around the map. Separate the Crew. Disperse everyone on the map to a random vent, given that they are not Immovable. You cannot have any other button modifiers with Disperser. Disperse You can disperse players on the map to random vents, which you can do once per game.
Saboteur Your sabotage cooldowns are reduced. You have reduced sabotage cooldowns. You have a reduced cooldown when sabotaging.
Telepath You're informed about teammates' kills and deaths. You're informed about teammates' kills. Know when your teammate kills Know when \%and\% where your teammate kills , know when they die , know when \%and\% where they die. Your teammate, \%player\%, has killed. Your teammate, \%player\%, has been murdered! Your teammate, \%player\%, guessed \%victim\% as \%role\%! Your teammate, \%player\%, attempted to guess \%victim\% as \%role\%, but failed!
Know Where Teammate Kills Know When Teammate Dies Know Where Teammate Dies Dead Body Arrow Duration Know When Teammate Guesses Successfully Know When Teammate Fails To Guess
Underdog Your kill cooldown is faster when you're on your own. When you're alone your kill cooldown is shortened. Your kill cooldown is lower if you're solo or your teammate is dead.
Kill Cooldown Bonus Increased Kill Cooldown When 2+ Imps
Assassin
Double Shot You get a second chance when guessing. You get a second chance when you fail to guess a player in a meeting. You have an extra chance when assassinating.
Aftermath You trigger your killer's abilities upon death. Your killer will be forced to use their abilities! After you die, your killer will be forced to use their abilities on your body or themselves. \%player\% was \%modifier\%, forcing you to use your ability.
Bait You force your killer to report your body. Force your killer to self-report. After you die, your killer will self-report, reporting your body. \%player\% was \%modifier\%, causing you to self report.
Min Bait Report Delay Max Bait Report Delay
Celebrity You reveal info about your death in the meeting. Announce how you died on your passing. After you die, details about your death will be revealed such as where you were killed and which role killed you during the meeting. The Celebrity, \%player\%, has died!:(Details in chat) Celebrity Report The \%modifier\%, \%player\%, has died!\%nl\%Location: \%room\%\%nl\%Death: By Suicide\%nl\%Time: \%timeAgo\% seconds ago. The \%modifier\%, \%player\%, was \%killed\%!\%nl\%Location: \%room\%\%nl\%Death: By The \%role\%\%nl\%Time: \%timeAgo\% seconds ago.
Circumvent Your ability to vent is limited. You lack the ability to vent. You cannot vent. Vents remaining: \%amount\% Your ability to vent around the map is severely weakened, or may be unavailable in general.
Deadly Quota You must kill at least one person. You must kill at least \%amount\% people. Meet your quota or lose!\%nl\%Kills: \%amount\% / \%total\% You lose if you do not complete your quota. To complete your quota, you need to kill a set number of people chosen at the start of the game. You haven't started working on your quota. You WILL lose if Impostors win, and you do not meet your quota of \%amount\% by the end of the game.
Diseased You extend your killer's cooldown upon death. Increase your killer's kill cooldown. Your murderer's kill cooldown is multiplied by a factor of \%cooldownMultiplier\%x. \%player\% was \%modifier\%, causing your kill cooldown to multiply by \%cooldownMultiplier\%.
Diseased Kill Modifier
Frosty Slow down your killer upon death. Slow your killer for a short duration. After you die, your killer will be slowed down! \%player\% was \%modifier\%, causing you to be slower for \%time\% seconds.
Chill Duration Chill Start Speed
You see others' footsteps. See everyone's footprints. The Investigator can see player's footprints throughout the game. Swooped players' footprints will not be visible to the Investigator.
Multitasker See through tasks. Your tasks are transparent. All your menus are see-through, allowing you to look behind menus!
Noisemaker Alert all players to your body upon death. When you die, you will send an alert to all players on the map for \%noiseTime\% second(s). After your death, you will show a red body indicator to everyone on the map.
Impostors Get Alert Neutrals Get Alert Comms Sabotage Prevents Alert Only Triggers If a Body Exists Alert Duration
Operative Use security systems on-the-go. Utilize the Cameras from anywhere. Use cameras at anytime with a limited battery charge.
Move While Using Mira Doorlog Starting Charge Battery Charged Each Round Battery Charged Per Task Security Display Cooldown Max Security Display Duration
Rotting Your body rots away upon death. Your body will rot away after \%rotDelay\% second(s). After \%rotDelay\% second(s), your body will rot away, preventing you from being reported
Time Before Body Rots Away
Scientist Use vitals on-the-go. Access vitals anytime, anywhere, as long as you have charge. Access Vitals at anytime with a limited battery charge.
Move While Using Vitals Starting Charge Battery Charged Each Round Battery Charged Per Task Vitals Display Cooldown Max Vitals Display Duration
Scout See farther in light, be blinder in the dark. Your vision is higher when lights are on, but very low when lights are off. While you can see twice as far as a regular crewmate, your vision falters when lights are off.
Gain extra information on the Admin Table Gain extra information on the Admin Table. The Spy gains extra information on the admin table. They now not only see how many people are in a room, but see who is in every room.
Taskmaster Automatically finish random tasks each round. A random task is auto completed for you after each meeting. Every time a round starts, you will automatically finish a task. The task \%taskName\%' has been completed for you.
Torch See without lights on. Your vision won't get reduced\%nl\%when the lights are sabotaged. The lights being off do not affect your vision.
